title: Decimal

significand.description: The significant digits of the number.

exponent.description:
Represents the position of the decimal point within the significand.

When the exponent is 0, the value of the Decimal is simply the value of
`significand`.

When the exponent is > 0, represents the number of trailing zeroes after
the significant digits.

When the exponent is < 0, represents how many of the significant digits
(and implicit leading zeroes, as needed) come after the decmial point.

When unset, this value is implicitly zero (0).
